title: 110_hr152
content: The Act titled "Comprehensive Insurance Coverage of Childhood Immunization Act of 2007" mandates comprehensive coverage for childhood immunization by group health plans and health insurance issuers. This includes amendments to the Public Health Service Act to ensure standard coverage of childhood immunization. The Act mandates comprehensive coverage for routine immunizations for individuals under 19 years of age by group health plans and health insurance issuers. Coverage includes vaccines without deductibles or coinsurance according to the Recommended Childhood Immunization Schedule. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include a new section. SEC. 714. STANDARD RELATING TO COVERAGE OF CHILDHOOD IMMUNIZATION. The text chunk discusses the requirement for group health plans and health insurance issuers to provide comprehensive coverage for routine immunizations for individuals under 19 years of age without any deductibles or cost-sharing. This is in accordance with the Recommended Childhood Immunization Schedule issued by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. The Act is amended to include a new item after section 713 regarding comprehensive coverage for routine immunizations for individuals under 19 years of age. The Act is amended to include a new section 2753 regarding coverage of childhood immunization in individual health insurance. This aligns with section 2707 for health insurance coverage in the individual market. Coordination of administration is also addressed. SEC. 3. COORDINATION OF ADMINISTRATION. The Secretaries of Health and Human Services and Labor must ensure that regulations and policies related to the same matter are administered consistently to avoid duplication of efforts. SEC. 4. EFFECTIVE DATES. The amendments made by section 2(a) apply to group health plans starting January 1, 2008, while the amendment made by section 2(b) applies to individual health insurance coverage in the individual market. There is an exception for group health plans under collective bargaining agreements ratified before the enactment of the Act. The plan's bargaining agreements have terminated, determined without regard to any extensions agreed to after the enactment of the Act or January 1, 2008. Plan amendments made to conform to new requirements added by section 2(a) under collective bargaining agreements will not be considered a termination of the agreement.
